result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon S. Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: probation currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time work and school and when not fully engaged, must complete 10 hours of community service per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Enroll in and complete SAFE program or equivalent program.  Counseling recommended.  

DNA sample.  

No objection to transfer of probation to Wood County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon S. Payne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case called: 11:12 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Julie Sawyer;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
Ct.1 (Battery)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct-Repeater-Domestic Abuse)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  
Parties make arguments regarding sentencing.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H- 18 months probation, concurrent to the probation currently being served. CONDITIONS: Enroll in and complete the SAFE Program or an equivalent program, counseling as recommended, Maintain Full time Work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including Domestic Abuse Surcharge, DNA Sample and Surcharge. No objection for transfer to Wood County. COURT finds 1 day credit. 

Adjourned: 11:26 am
